crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
While the successful configuration of your application upon the CRNRSTN Suite :: relies on $oCRNRSTN (the instantiation of the crnrstn :: class object) with all of it's various methods...as they are invoked...in the CRNRSTN configuration file, the primary interface between the CRNRSTN Suite :: and the application comes into existence through the instantiation of the environmentals :: class object ($oCRNRSTN_ENV) at the end of the CRNRSTN Suite configuration file _crnrstn.config.inc.php.
If the $oCRNRSTN class object has not detected the running environment (no integer passed to $oCRNRSTN->requiredDetectionMatches()), when the environmentals class object is instantiated it's __construct() will select the CRNRSTN environmental configuration profile with the greatest number of matches against the values of indices of the $_SERVER[ ] super global. Once $oCRNRSTN_ENV has determined the profile for the running environment, it then extracts from $oCRNRSTN (and commits to $_SESSION[ ]) the configuration data that is relevant ONLY to that particular environmental profile. A solid effort has been made to keep the memory footprint as small as possible. For example, after $oCRNRSTN_ENV is successfully instantiated, $oCRNRSTN is deleted to free up memory resources, and from that point forward $oCRNRSTN_ENV becomes the object through which all of the environment's configuration data (and CRNRSTN Suite :: functionality) is accessed.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.
